uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.separation

Class MarkedGraphSeparation

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.separation.MarkedGraphSeparation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Separation

    class MarkedGraphSeparation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Separation
    This class quickly finds solutions to separation problems for TS satisfying some properties. A marked graph is a plain t-net Petri net. This implementation is based on the theory presented in "Characterisation of the State Spaces of Marked Graph Petri Nets" by Eike Best and Raymond Devillers.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

      • MarkedGraphSeparation

        public MarkedGraphSeparation(RegionUtility utility,
                             PNProperties properties,
                             java.lang.String[] locationMap)
                      throws UnsupportedPNPropertiesException
        Construct a new instance for solving separation problems.
        Parameters:
        utility - The region utility to use.
        properties - Properties that the calculated region should satisfy.
        locationMap - Mapping that describes the location of each event.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedPNPropertiesException - If the requested properties are not supported.

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger>> calculateParikhVectorOfUniqueReachedState(RegionUtility utility)
        Calculate the parikh vectors of the unique states that are only reached by a single event.
        Parameters:
        utility - region utility to use
        Returns:
        A map from event index to the parikh vector of the state for that event
